item.title: Michigan bats - featuring the Iron Mountain Bat Mine
item.description: some notes for a project that my oldest is doing - from the Michigan DNR: Landowner’s Guide, Bats The little brown bat is especially abundant throughout the state and is the most seen species. A light brown to dark brown in color, little browns are fairly small in size with a wingspan of 8 1⁄2 to 11 1⁄2 inches, small ears, and large feet. In summer, colonies of the species live in hot attics and under shingles and siding; in winter, they hibernate in caves, crevices, houses, hollow trees, or mines.
